item.title: IT warning after 160-year-old firm goes into administration following a ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Even though the media often mentions the risk of businesses folding due to a cyberattack, attempts to find examples of where a cyberattack really was the sole explanation/cause are often hard to find. Whether there were any other financial factors in the case reported here that contributed to the firm going into administration is unknown...

item.title: Alleged Nomad Bridge Hacker Arrested and Faces US Extradition
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Trader Edge reports: A Russian-Israeli citizen allegedly involved in the $190 million Nomad bridge hack from 2022 has been arrested in Israel and faces extradition to the United States. Alexander Gurevich was apprehended at Ben-Gurion Airport on May 1 while attempting to board a flight to Russia. Gurevich is accused of being the first to...

item.title: California man pleads guilty to wire fraud for $1 million fraud scheme to steal from his employer
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Today’s reminder of the insider threat: Seattle – A 43-year-old Laguna Niguel, California man pleaded guilty today in U.S. District Court in Seattle to wire fraud for his scheme to steal nearly $1 million from his employer, announced Acting U.S. Attorney Teal Luthy Miller. Paul Joseph Welch was the IT manager of Kent, Washington energy...

item.title: Negotiations with the Akira ransomware group: an ill-advised approach
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: @Chum1ng0 took a look at four victims of Akira and what happened in terms of negotiations or not. In translation: After a detailed analysis, we identified four chats from different companies that attempted to communicate with Akira after being attacked. Some of these companies were still listed as victims on the group’s website. Days after...

item.title: Data Breach at Fowler Elementary School District: The Interlock Ransomware Group’s Attack
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: It sounds like yet another K-12 school district has fallen prey to a cyberattack that it never successfully detected or thwarted quickly. SuspectFile reports: The Fowler Elementary School District, located in Phoenix, Arizona, has reportedly fallen victim to a cyberattack involving what may be a substantial volume of sensitive data. The incident was claimed by...

item.title: Patients left in the dark almost a year after criminals leaked sensitive medical data from Synnovis
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Alexander Martin reports: More than 11 months after a ransomware group published information from a U.K. pathology services company, the affected patients still have not been informed about what data of theirs was exposed in the incident, with material about sexually transmitted infections and cancer cases being included in the leaks. The data was compromised...

item.title: Disney Hacker Who Accessed 1.1 Terabytes of Data Pleads Guilty
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: There’s an update to a previously reported breach claimed by “Nullbulge.” Pirates and Princesses reports: A California resident has pleaded guilty to charges related to hacking a Disney employee’s personal computer, resulting in the theft of more than 1 terabyte of confidential data. Last year, it was reported that a hacker accessed Disney’s files and released...

item.title: Co-op hackers boast of ‘stealing 20 million customers’ data’ – as retailer admits impacts of ‘significant’ attack
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Jacob Paul reports: The cyber attackers allegedly behind a hack on the Co-op have bragged about vast scale of their attack, forcing the supermarket chain to row back on claims it suffered a “small impact”. DragonForce, the criminal group claiming responsibility, has alleged it managed to infiltrate IT networks and steal 20 million customer’s data....

item.title: Qilin announces attack on Cobb County, Georgia
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: On May 1, Qilin added Cobb County, Georgia to its dark web leak site. The ransomware gang claims to have acquired 150 GB of data and more than 400,000 files. They provided 16 image files as proof of their claims. Qilin threatens to release the data on May 3 if no payment is received. Because...

item.title: Saskatoon children’s hospital nurse unlawfully snooped on records of 314 patients: privacy report
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Brandon Harder provides this morning’s reminder of the insider threat: Without legal authority, a nurse who worked at Saskatoon’s Jim Pattison Children’s Hospital snooped on the private medical records of 314 patients, according to a recent report. The report, dated April 23 and signed by Saskatchewan Information and Privacy Commissioner Ronald J. Kruzeniski, states that...
